str2: Probably from the same as pale; anew, i.e. back, once more, or furthermore or on the other hand.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Singular
Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: A prolonged form of a primary heuro, which heureo is used for it in all the tenses except the present and imperfect to find.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative Masculine 3rd Person Plural
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Accusative Masculine Plural
str2: To sleep, be sleeping. From kata and heudo; to lie down to rest, i.e. to fall asleep.
For. A primary particle; properly, assigning a reason.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive Masculine 3rd Person Plural
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
The eye; fig: the mind's eye. From optanomai; the eye; by implication, vision; figuratively, envy.

parse: Verb - Imperfect Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: I am, exist. The first person singular present indicative; a prolonged form of a primary and defective verb; I exist.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Middle or Passive - Nominative Masculine Plural
str2: To burden, oppress, weigh down. From kata and bareo; to impose upon.

parse: Verb - Pluperfect Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
Interrogative / Indefinite Pronoun - Accusative Neuter Singular
str2: Who, which, what, why. Probably emphatic of tis; an interrogative pronoun, who, which or what.

parse: Verb - Aorist Subjunctive Passive - 3rd Person Plural
str2: From apo and krino; to conclude for oneself, i.e. to respond; by Hebraism to begin to speak.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
